channel.title: EarShot: Must listen audio from the best storytellers on the internet
channel.description: EarShot: Must listen audio from the best storytellers on the internet

item.title: Lost At Sea
item.description:
Lost At Sea

When people ask me for podcast recommendations, I always start with Lost at Sea by Deborah Scaling Kiley. An incredible story of adventure, struggle and survival. Scaling passed away in 2012, but her story shared on The Moth Podcast in 2009 holds up as an all time favorite.

item.title: The Living Room
item.description:
The Living Room

Diane Weipert - Voyeur Diane's new neighbors across the way never shut their curtains, and that was the beginning of an intimate, but very one-sided relationship. Diane Weipert is a writer and filmmaker. Produced by Briana Breen.

item.title: Structural Integrity
item.description:
Structural Integrity

Roman Mars via 99% Invisible brings us the story about an audacious architecture undergrad who discovers a critical design flaw in a 59 story highrise in New York City. This story blows my mind thinking about "what could have been" if the winds were strong enough.

item.title: Rest Stop
item.description:
Rest Stop

Rest Stop: A classic episode from the genius producers at This American Life. As billed on the epidsode description: "Nine radio producers. Two days. One rest stop on the New York State Thruway." These guys somehow find the most interesting people and tell their stories in a way that give you a feeling of Americana and nostalgia.

item.title: The Cathedral
item.description:
The Cathedral

In terms of heart wrenching stories about cancer, childhood and death, The Cathedral by Reply All takes the cake. I guarantee you'll ball your eyes out, but this is a must listen episode from the talented folks at Gimlet Media.
